column4: Hey, for some reason my menu.lst, no matter what changes i do to it, they dont show up in grub, I even changed the friggin initrd to something random, and it didnt change it in grub, I ran update-grub, it changed a couple things in my menu.lst, but my grub is still loading an old menu.lst, and I have no idea where its coming from, I even ran find|grep menu.lst, and didnt find any other ones

Hey, for some reason my menu.lst, no matter what changes i do to it, they dont show up in grub, I even changed the friggin initrd to something random, and it didnt change it in grub, I ran update-grub, it changed a couple things in my menu.lst, but my grub is still loading an old menu.lst, and I have no idea where its coming from, I even ran find|grep menu.lst, and didnt find any other ones
use terminal    sudo apt-get install pastebinit  && cat /boot/grub/menu.lst | pastebinit (Provide Pastebin link in channel)
http://pastebin.com/f2a0d3e0
In grub, kernel 24-18 doesnt show up, and 24-17 is still loading /boot/newinit2 (My custom initrd)
Whops, nvm about newinit2
do you get 7 options when you boot your grub.. do you have anyother linux installs on your system?
Nope, this is my only "Linux" I have installed, and yes, I get 7
Clearly the -18 kernel is in your list
Yes, but in grub, it doesnt show up
does the tile of the first one show 18
Nope
do you get 7 options when you boot your grub
Yes, I get the two Windows, Memtest, -16 recovery, -16, -17 recovery, and -17
try adding a blank line above the entry for -18
that should not have an effect.. but stranger things have happened
kk, rebooting to test
Yup, doesnt show up
I know it dint work...  look at title in your -18 kernel.. notice CAP T and not lower case t.. sorry, I didnt see that until you logged out
K
Thanks, it worked
